data.label:
Narrator

I had been invited to Cavette, the capital of Morella, for a meeting with Prime Minister Alma Saltana.

Alma Saltana

"Welcome back to Morella, {RiziaDLCText.SaltanaToPlayer}."

Player_Romus

"Quite a lovely park you have here."

Player_Romus

"I'm surprised you haven't gotten rid of this. Why keep around reminders of the Valgos occupation?"

Player_Romus

"The Valgos Empire used our family's conflict as an excuse for a land grab. Both of our countries lost territory."

Player_Romus

"They look delicious, but I ate before I came here."

Narrator

We each took a biscuit off the tray.

Narrator

The waiter, however, seemed to have disappeared without serving us anything to drink.

Narrator

As we kept walking, I noticed the corner of a wooden object peeking out from behind the stalks.

Alma Saltana

"At least we were able to take back the territory we lost."

Player_Romus

"Mphhmrmphrm."

Player_Romus

"Mphhmrmphrm."

Player_Romus

"Ffffrmmhhhhfhmph."

Player_Romus

"How did you manage to reclaim such a large swathe of land, anyway?"

Player_Romus

"I'm surprised that Morella doesn't still bear a grudge against the Valgs."

Alma Saltana

"I hate to admit it, but my right-wing predecessors happened to be very good strategists."

Alma Saltana

"His administration has made an admirable attempt to atone for the Valgos Empire's misdeeds."

Alma Saltana

"The world would be a better place if more countries followed his example."

Narrator

Her eyebrow arched.

Player_Romus

"And the Reinharts? What do you think of them?"

Alma Saltana

"It helped that with its coast blocked, Morella was compelled to invest more into its air force."

Player_Romus

"Impressive. I'd love to learn more about those planes."

Player_Romus

"Did you ever feel tempted to take over *all* of Pales?"

Narrator

We drank. The tea was delicious.

Narrator

Saltana leaned forward.

Narrator

Once he'd filled mine, I drank immediately. The hot tea nearly scalded my throat, but I could speak again.

Player_Romus

"That was a nasty stunt."

Player_Romus

"If that was an attempt to intimidate me, you have failed."

Narrator

She blinked innocently.

Player_Romus

"I am all for increasing Morella's profit share. But nationalization was simply too extreme of a solution."

Player_Romus

"Sorry, but the Rizian economy is dependent on gold from the ITZ. We can offer you other things, but the Trade Zone conditions must stay the same."

Alma Saltana

"We don't wish to antagonize either Rizia or Lespia. But we will not go back to the way things were."

Player_Romus

"And *we* will not let Valgsland and the CSP get their grubby hands into our business."

Player_Romus

"Is that a threat, Ms. Saltana? You'll spark a revolution in Rizia if you don't get what you want?"

Alma Saltana

"I believe there's a certain... spirit in your country. One that, if given the proper support and channels, could bring about monumental change."

Player_Romus

"I get the point. I'm willing to negotiate with you."

Player_Romus

"You made your point. Can we discuss the agreement now?"

Narrator

She sighed.

Alma Saltana

"It's good to know that you're flexible."

Anti-Nationalization Ate Cookie

Anti-Nationalization Ate Cookie

Anti-Nationalization No Cookie

Anti-Nationalization No Cookie

Narrator

She smiled wryly.

Alma Saltana

"It's certainly not my intention to grant one country a better deal than another."

Player_Romus

"Rizia wants to be Morella's sole energy supplier. You will purchase oil or natural gas from us at a price that we determine."

Player_Romus

"You're aware of our present difficulties with the Zille region. We would ask for your aid in taking it back from Wehlen."

Player_Romus

"We're involved in an arbitration dispute over the Aureus gas field. We would like your public support in this matter."

Player_Romus

"I want you to marry me. By bringing back the tradition of intermarriage between your nation and my kingdom, we will reestablish our dominion over South Merkopa."

Alma Saltana

"You do realize what year it is?"

Narrator

She seemed to mull it over.

Player_Romus

"Wehlen's intervention was my father's idea, not mine. My duty is to ensure the peaceful transfer of Zille back to Rizia."

Player_Romus

"No, we'd be puppets of Arcasia. Which would be a big problem for *you*."

Player_Romus

"Are we here to talk politics, or are we making deals? Let's be pragmatic, Ms. Saltana."

Alma Saltana

"You don't know that. Perhaps with Morella's assistance, Rizia would have been able to blaze its own trail."

Player_Romus

"Not every revolution turns out the way you want it to, Ms. Saltana. Can you really say modern-day Derdia is better off than the Empire of Moridia?"

Alma Saltana

"You do seem to be a more enlightened breed of monarch."

Alma Saltana

"And you're sure that you will have a steady supply of energy to sell us?"

Player_Romus

"Rizia is providing strategical assistance to certain local factions that support our aims. We'd like Morella's help in covertly shipping supplies to those factions."

Narrator

She paused.

Player_Romus

"We are. But it can't hurt to have a backup plan."

Alma Saltana

"You may be right about that."

Player_Romus

"Completely non-violent. Its goal is to increase pro-Rizian sympathies in the region, nothing more."

Player_Romus

"It is a group of freedom fighters trying to cast off the shackles of Wehzek oppression."

Alma Saltana

"There is nothing I would like more than to condemn Wiktor Smolak and his one-man reign of terror on an international stage."

Player_Romus

"Yes, even if the Aureus gas field arbitration doesn't go our way, we have plenty of alternatives."

Player_Romus

"That's not for you to worry about."

Player_Romus

"Our oil deal with Wehlen is going through, we'll be able to build a pipeline straight to Morella soon."

Player_Romus

"Nationalization is also a large commitment, Ms. Saltana."

Alma Saltana

"Through Derdia, I presume."

Player_Romus

"I was joking. Shame on you for believing I would only see a powerful female leader like you as marriage material."

Player_Romus

"You asked for Rizia's demands. It was worth a shot."

Alma Saltana

"It's completely insulting to treat a female world leader as mere marriage fodder."

Alma Saltana

"And I'm going to have a lot of trouble taking you seriously going forward."

Player_Romus

"We have covered all of Rizia's demands. Now, which will Morella agree to fulfill?"

Alma Saltana

"If you can get the Supreme Wiseman to agree to that, we would be interested."

Alma Saltana

"Please. You can't just make promises without telling me how you're going to follow up on them."

Alma Saltana

"Understood."

Narrator

She frowned.

Player_Romus

"Well, Rizia has a large amount of energy to sell."

Alma Saltana

"What else was on your list?"

Player_Romus

"It would send a strong signal to the superpowers. South Merkopa can rely on itself."

Alma Saltana

"It would also send a signal to your coalition of monarchies. GRACE, was it?"

Alma Saltana

"No, I do."

Alma Saltana

"Good."

Alma Saltana

"I'm wary of entering into an energy arrangement with the man whose family occupied my country for over a century. Even an indirect one."

Alma Saltana

"I would rather not harm our upcoming round of negotiations with Lespia."

Alma Saltana

"That depends, {RiziaDLCText.SaltanaToPlayer}."

Alma Saltana

"We were planning on meeting a limited number of your demands in addition to offering you a 20 percent share in the new ITZ."

Player_Romus

"What if I want to buy Lespia's share along with Rizia's?"

Player_Romus

"Is that what you're offering Lespia as well?"

Player_Romus

"Damn. I was about to ask whether Rizia could buy Lespia's share."

Player_Romus

"That greedy bastard. I hope you turned him down."

Player_Romus

"And what would Rizia have to do to prevent that from happening?"

Player_Romus

"You'd accept energy from Lespia *and* grant them a 40 percent stake in the ITZ? Valgsland would hate that."

Player_Romus

"The same way you made it worth Valgsland's while?"

Alma Saltana

"We're not expecting Lespia's approval on the final proposal. So except for the share offer, we don't feel compelled to be as generous."

Alma Saltana

"And we do want to make up for your kingdom's loss of revenue. We know how important gold has been to Rizia in the past."

Player_Romus

"I've heard great things about Morellan-built aircraft. I would like some for the Rizian air force."

Alma Saltana

"That can be arranged. Not for free, but we'll give you a good price on our best stock."

Player_Romus

"We have ATO member states to our north and south. We must be able to defend ourselves from their encroaching influence."

Player_Romus

"I am worried about escalation with Pales. We must be prepared in case of conflict."

Player_Romus

"Nothing you need to know about."

Alma Saltana

"Our own conflict with Pales is long over. I was hoping it would stay that way."

Alma Saltana

"It is Rizia's system of government that needs to be brought into the modern age, not its artillery."

Narrator

She frowned.

Alma Saltana

"We can't top the size or firepower of their military. But we can show the West we will not be easily intimidated."

Alma Saltana

"But if the situation did escalate, we would be obliged to support you."

Narrator

She laughed mirthlessly.

Alma Saltana

"Not yet."

Alma Saltana

"Where we get our energy from is up to us, not Chancellor Hegel."

Alma Saltana

"Believe it or not, Valgsland refused to accept anything other than standard compensation for its assets."

Alma Saltana

"With that said, should it prove difficult to secure your kingdom's cooperation, we'll be forced to turn to them."

Player_Romus

"Yes. We will accept your offer of a 20 percent share in the restructured Trade Zone."

Player_Romus

"First, let's talk about what Rizia would have to do to buy Lespia's share."

Player_Romus

"Gladly. Those radical Golcondists are a threat to all of us."

Player_Romus

"And by 'dealing with', you mean 'killing'?"

Alma Saltana

"*All* of them? We'll have to see about that."

Player_Romus

"No share. And we're not going to make any demands of you, either. Nationalization is its own reward."

Narrator

Surprise registered on her face.

Alma Saltana

"Most of the Derdians entering Morella are trying to migrate to Rizia. So this is your problem as much as it is ours."

Player_Romus

"I can already tell you I am not interested in angering the Supreme Wiseman."

Player_Romus

"Because you're a woman."

Player_Romus

"Because you have the temperament of a petulant child."

Player_Romus

"Because you're an atheist."

Alma Saltana

"Exactly. The Supreme Wiseman refuses to negotiate with female leaders."

Alma Saltana

"You'd think that would be a factor. But no, the Supreme Wiseman simply refuses to negotiate with female leaders."

Alma Saltana

"But no. The Supreme Wiseman refuses to negotiate with female leaders."

Alma Saltana

"But I have a hunch he will respect a king and fellow Wruhecist. Your border ban notwithstanding."

Player_Romus

"This is not my kingdom's conflict. I'd rather not get involved in it."

Alma Saltana

"Thank you. We'll make sure you are well compensated for your loss of income."

Narrator

She narrowed her eyes.

Narrator

She smiled.

Narrator

She looked at me suspiciously.

Narrator

She laughed lightly.

Narrator

She nibbled on the corner of her own biscuit, then took a slow, deliberate sip of tea.

Player_Romus

"You're fooling yourself if you think Rizia will do the same."

Alma Saltana

"I don't expect that at all. But I do expect change."

Alma Saltana

"Typical anti-Malenyevism. You'd never agree to lose money without an ulterior motive, so you accuse everyone else of having one too."

Alma Saltana

"What Valgsland chooses to do with its share is not Rizia's business."

Alma Saltana

"It is a step in the right direction."

Alma Saltana

"That means regulations similar to the ones you already passed in Rizia, applied to every company that is active in the Trade Zone."

Alma Saltana

"That means regulations similar to the ones you already passed in Rizia -- but applicable to mining corporations."

Player_Romus

"That's only fair. A company's standards should be the same, no matter the country in which it's operating."

Player_Romus

"That is a fair request. I will consider supporting it."

Player_Romus

"That'll be a problem. I passed those regulations in Rizia because I knew our MITZ profits could make up for the loss of income."

Player_Romus

"I already regret passing those regulations. The financial burden was more crushing than I expected."

Player_Romus

"Have you ever worked in a mine in your life? How can you claim to speak for miners?"

Player_Romus

"I sympathize with the workers' plight. But my parliament believes such regulations are an unfair financial burden to corporations."

Alma Saltana

"I hope you'll do more than consider it."

Player_Romus

"It's the voice of my people. I have to do what they say."

Alma Saltana

"So you were literally banking on the exploitation of Morellans? Sorry if I don't sympathize."

Alma Saltana

"Thank you for agreeing."

Player_Romus

"The majority speaker is well connected to Rizia's businesses. She knows more than anyone about the potential impacts of these laws."

Player_Romus

"You will not insult my country's most prominent businessman."

Player_Romus

"We both know it's more complicated than that. A sizeable portion of Rizia's economy relies on RRG."

Alma Saltana

"I am not beholden to Rizian Royal Gold in any way. I stand by what I said."

Alma Saltana

"The mortality risk of miners working in the Trade Zone is twice as high as that of regular Morellans. The boost to our countries' economies is not worth human lives."

Player_Romus

"To be fair, every job comes with risks. I could be beheaded at any time."

Player_Romus

"You're absolutely right. People should always come before profits."

Alma Saltana

"A glib way of putting it. But yes."

Alma Saltana

"What about the people whose lives improved because of the laws you passed? Do they count for nothing?"

Alma Saltana

"It makes no sense that people on one side of our border should suffer so the other side can live in blind luxury."

Alma Saltana

"Good."

Alma Saltana

"I never said that."

Alma Saltana

"I... You know very well what I meant."

Alma Saltana

"Well... good."

Alma Saltana

"I'm assuming by your lack of a response that I have made myself clear."

Player_Romus

"Would you also approve the reallocation of Lespia's ITZ share to Rizia?"

Narrator

She regarded me cautiously.

Alma Saltana

"In any event, you're making a very bold request."

Player_Romus

"What if we shrank Rizia's share in the new agreement? Morella would have majority control of the ITZ, and you could implement as much oversight as you wanted."

Narrator

Saltana looked puzzled.

Player_Romus

"Actually, let's talk about everyone's shares staying the same. What would it take for Morella to vote to keep the ITZ the way it is?"

Player_Romus

"But we'd be a more trustworthy partner than Lespia."

Alma Saltana

"I'm not sure I believe that."

Player_Romus

"We wouldn't try anything. Rizia is completely on board with your vision for the future of the ITZ."

Player_Romus

"We are prepared to sweeten the deal."

Alma Saltana

"I'm surprised you would suggest that. You and the Prime Minister seemed to be on the same page during the board meeting."

Narrator

She hesitated.

Alma Saltana

"No offense, but you had better be."

Alma Saltana

"As it happens, Lespia recently contacted us with an attractive energy proposition. To gain the upper hand in our upcoming negotiations, I suspect."

Player_Romus

"It would put you in our debt. There are things Rizia needs more than gold."

Player_Romus

"Watching as Lespia is forced to comply with your rules would be enough of a reward for me."

Alma Saltana

"I believe you. But you're asking for too much."

Alma Saltana

"Even if we'd gone through with nationalization, I never would have cut Lespia out of the ITZ completely. Their contributions to it have been too great."

Player_Romus

"We're prepared to top whatever Mr. Alvarez is offering. Just tell me what you want."

Player_Romus

"A substantial commitment? Forget I asked, then."

Player_Romus

"An energy deal with Lespia? Valgsland wouldn't like that at all."

Alma Saltana

"Agreeing to transfer their share to Rizia would therefore require a substantial commitment from you."

Alma Saltana

"We are on the verge of exhausting our own oil reserves. We cannot be picky."

Alma Saltana

"Here's what it would take to turn down Lespia's offer and allow Rizia to purchase their share."

Share Allocation

Share Allocation

Player_Romus

"He's an untrustworthy drunk. The MITZ is better off without him."

Player_Romus

"We were. But my mind has changed since then."

Alma Saltana

"But if you'd rather accept compensation, our offers still stand."

Player_Romus

"Perhaps so, but he was always going to betray me. I'm just getting ahead of him."

Alma Saltana

"I can't say I dislike the idea."

Alma Saltana

"I'm surprised you would suggest that. You and the Prime Minister seemed to be on the same page during the board meeting."

Player_Romus

"He's an untrustworthy drunk. The ITZ is better off without him."

Player_Romus

"We were. But my mind has changed since then."

Player_Romus

"Perhaps so, but he was always going to betray me. I'm just getting ahead of him."

Alma Saltana

"We would ask that you offer us an energy partnership equal in value to the one Lespia proposed."

Alma Saltana

"We'd require your assistance in dealing with the Derdians attempting to infiltrate our borders."

Player_Romus

"Gladly. Those radical Golcondists are a threat to all of us."

Player_Romus

"And by 'dealing with', you mean 'killing'?"

Player_Romus

"I can already tell you I am not interested in angering the Supreme Wiseman."

Alma Saltana

"It's a little late for that. He's already mad as hell over your border ban."

Alma Saltana

"You wouldn't have to make him angry."

Player_Romus

"Because you're a woman."

Player_Romus

"Because you have the manners of a petulant child."

Player_Romus

"Because you're an atheist."

Player_Romus

"Because of the lingering animosity between your countries."

Alma Saltana

"An agnostic Zaranist, actually. But no, the Supreme Wiseman refuses to negotiate with female leaders."

Alma Saltana

"You'd think that would be a factor. But no, the Supreme Wiseman simply refuses to negotiate with female leaders."

Narrator

She sat back and glared at me.

Alma Saltana

"But no. The Supreme Wiseman refuses to negotiate with female leaders."

Player_Romus

"You're right. This is best settled between us men."

Player_Romus

"This is not my kingdom's conflict. I'd rather not get involved in it."

Alma Saltana

"I thought you Rizians were enlightened."

Alma Saltana

"But I have a hunch he will respect a king and fellow Wruhecist."

Alma Saltana

"Your own treatment of Golcondists cannot have escaped Derdia's attention. The conflict will come to Rizia sooner or later."

Alma Saltana

"For both of our countries' sake, I hope you do."

Alma Saltana

"But I have a hunch he will respect a king and fellow Wruhecist. Your border ban notwithstanding."

Player_Romus

"I can try my best. But I doubt I'd be able to get through to him."

Alma Saltana

"One would think."

Player_Romus

"That should be fine. We're already building a gas pipeline from Pales to Rizia. It shoud be no problem to extend it to Morella."

Player_Romus

"Perfect. We'll be looking for new customers once the Alliance of Nation grants us the rights to our new gas field."

Player_Romus

"That might difficult. We have pre-existing energy arrangements with other countries."

Player_Romus

"I'd love to be able to promise you a steady supply of energy. But I am not sure I can."

Player_Romus

"Certainly, Madam Prime Minister. Our energy stores are as robust as ever."

Alma Saltana

"The one next to Pales?"

Alma Saltana

"If you're not willing to make this deal, you'll have to be content with a smaller share."

Player_Romus

"Leave the dealings with the Duke to us. Rizia will handle everything."

Player_Romus

"Past is past, Ms. Saltana. The current Duke respects Morella's sovereignty."

Alma Saltana

"I will tell you right away that I don't want anything to do with the Grand Duke."

Alma Saltana

"There is one other option..."

Alma Saltana

"I have one final condition."

Alma Saltana

"In fact, I don't think I can agree on that unless you agree to all of the demands I mentioned earlier."

Narrator

She hesitated.

Alma Saltana

"But I might agree to take their share, in exchange for at least a few of the demands I mentioned earlier."

Alma Saltana

"Why are you suggesting this? What would be in it for Rizia?"

Player_Romus

"Getting Western influence out of the ITZ is a win for all of us."

Player_Romus

"Don't worry about what would be in it for us. You deserve this."

Player_Romus

"The ITZ would be managed by two neighboring countries. You must see the benefit in that."

Alma Saltana

"Is that you talking? Or Chancellor Hegel?"

Alma Saltana

"The problem is that Prime Minister Alvarez recently contacted us with an attractive energy proposition. To gain the upper hand in our upcoming negotiations, I suspect."

Player_Romus

"I understand the position you're in."

Player_Romus

"We're prepared to top whatever Mr. Alvarez is offering."

Player_Romus

"An energy deal with Lespia? Valgsland wouldn't like that at all."

Alma Saltana

"You wouldn't have to top it. But we would ask for a commitment."

Narrator

She hesitated.

Player_Romus

"Don't worry about what would be in it for us. You deserve this."

Player_Romus

"The MITZ would be managed by two neighboring countries. You must see the benefit in that."

Alma Saltana

"I do. But even if the nationalization vote had gone through, my plan was never to leave Lespia with nothing."

...

"Even if the nationalization vote had gone through, my plan was never to leave Lespia with nothing."

Player_Romus

"A commitment? Forget I asked, then."

Player_Romus

"Go on."

Alma Saltana

"We've had our experts draw up an initial plan. It includes river cleaning initiatives, water purification systems for affected communities and increased penalties for environmental violations committed by mining companies."

Player_Romus

"I'm willing to pay whatever it takes to clean up the mess our companies made."

Alma Saltana

"However, your previous donation should entitle you to pay less."

Alma Saltana

"But I hope you'll agree that this is a necessary step towards rebuilding the trust between ITZ partners."

Player_Romus

"Rizia never broke any laws. We shouldn't have to pay at all."

Alma Saltana

"Additionally..."

Alma Saltana

"Alternately..."

Alma Saltana

"We would also ask for the following."

Alma Saltana

"First, a financial contribution towards the rehabilitation of the Arufelde river watershed."

Alma Saltana

"We would also ask for at least two of the following."

Alma Saltana

"We would also ask for at least one of the following."

Alma Saltana

"If that is absolutely not an option for Rizia, we would ask for one of the following."

Morella Demands Non-Nationalization

Morella Demands Non-Nationalization

Player_Romus

"While we're talking about the reallocation of shares... I have a proposal for you."

Player_Romus

"So Morella will have a 50 percent share in the ITZ. What else could you want?"

Alma Saltana

"Yes?"

Alma Saltana

"If Morella is to approve any new agreement for the Meftiem ITZ, it should include better worker protections at the very minimum."

Alma Saltana

"If that's what you believe, I'm confused you didn't just vote for nationalization."

Alma Saltana

"I see. And here I thought you were being altruistic."

Alma Saltana

"We'd be prepared to grant you favors in return. But not too many."

Player_Romus

"We want an energy deal. But one where we control the terms and prices."

Player_Romus

"We'd ask for Morella's assistance in extricating the territory of Zille from Wehzek hands."

Player_Romus

"We want a deal on Morellan airplanes. Rizia needs a stronger air force."

Player_Romus

"We wouldn't ask for much. Only your support in the gas field arbitration proceedings with Pales."

Player_Romus

"No favors. This is the least we can do."

Alma Saltana

"I'm sure that can be arranged."

Alma Saltana

"We'd do that with pleasure."

Alma Saltana

"I'm still confused. But I appreciate the offer."

Alma Saltana

"I'll tell you, {RiziaDLCText.SaltanaToPlayer}."

Alma Saltana

"On Rizia's side, we would only want you to agree to new mining regulations. Or at the very least, one of the other demands I mentioned."

Alma Saltana

"We would want you to agree to new mining regulations, in addition to at least one of the other demands I mentioned."

Player_Romus

"That's cheeky. All it would take is a stalemate between our four countries to maintain the status quo anyway."

Alma Saltana

"But would the status quo be maintained within the Rizian populace?"

Player_Romus

"That's reasonable, but do you really think Lespia will agree?"

Alma Saltana

"Morella's negotiations with Lespia are between myself and the Prime Minister."

Player_Romus

"You drive a hard bargain, Ms. Saltana."

Alma Saltana

"Golcondism is spreading, I fear. The conflict will come to Rizia sooner or later."

Alma Saltana

"Lastly..."

Alma Saltana

"Do we have an agreement? Or are there other options you'd like to discuss?"

Player_Romus

"We've discussed this enough. Here's what I propose."

Alma Saltana

"Please. Tell me."

Player_Romus

"I want Rizia and Lespia to keep our current shares. And I'm willing to meet your conditions to gain Morella's approval."

Player_Romus

"I want the new ITZ agreement to split the Trade Zone shares 50-50 between Rizia and Morella. Lespia will get nothing."

Player_Romus

"The new agreement should split the MITZ 75-25 between Morella and Rizia. We're kicking Lespia out of the Trade Zone."

Player_Romus

"Rizia will grant Morella part of our share, giving you majority control over the Trade Zone. But not without concessions from you."

Player_Romus

"There will be no new ITZ agreement. If we have to stay in a stalemate forever, so be it."

Narrator

She furiously pushed back her chair and stood up.

Alma Saltana

"I'm sorry to have wasted both of our time, then."

Alma Saltana

"But thank you for coming to the table. Literally and figuratively."

Narrator

She smiled.

Alma Saltana

"That's the outcome I was hoping for."

Narrator

She nodded earnestly.

Narrator

She smiled.

Alma Saltana

"We will be in touch shortly regarding the exact details. I expect that Rizia will hold to whatever promises are made."

Alma Saltana

"We will be in touch shortly regarding the exact details. Needless to say, Morella will hold to whatever promises are made."

Player_Romus

"No toast? No handshake?"

Player_Romus

"I would expect nothing less."

Player_Romus

"Halaita. If it is said, so it is, so it will be."

Alma Saltana

"Right."

Alma Saltana

"Not until it's finalized."

Player_Romus

"I look forward to working more closely together."

Alma Saltana

"You'll mostly be hearing from my cabinet. I prefer not to make unilateral decisions."

Narrator

She stood up and pushed her chair back.

Narrator

She stood up and pushed her chair back.

Player_Romus

"It wasn't a waste. Now I know my security forces should be on the lookout for Morellan revolutionaries."

Player_Romus

"It's not like that. I was also hoping we could find a solution that benefited all of us."

Player_Romus

"Thanks for the tea."

Player_Romus

"You should've known I'd never grant concessions to CSP cronies."

Alma Saltana

"Please feel free to take a biscuit for the trip back."

Alma Saltana

"What makes you think they'll be Morellan?"

Alma Saltana

"Goodbye, Mr. Toras."

Narrator

Our plan was to discuss how to proceed with the nationalization of the Meftiem International Trade Zone.

Narrator

My security detail and I exited our motorcade outside the gates of the People's Gardens, Cavette's largest park.

Narrator

Originally known as the Imperial Gardens, it had served as a private strolling ground for the Emperor of Moridia, then for the Reinhart family during the Valgish occupation.

Narrator

When Morella reconquered Cavette in 1923, the vast green area was opened to the public.

Narrator

Once immaculately landscaped with imported Valgish trees and flowers, the park was replanted with native Morellan flora and allowed to grow wild. Children played hide and seek in the tall grasses and raced each other up the conical hill in the center.

Player_Romus

"Looks like this place could use a good groundskeeper."

Narrator

She smiled patiently.

Alma Saltana

"It's a reclamation of sorts."

Alma Saltana

"The Valgish conquerors thought they could bend our nature to their will. In the end, they failed."

Alma Saltana

"We can arrange a tour of one of our air force bases, if there's time after our talk."

Player_Romus

"You like uprisings, do you?"

Player_Romus

"You don't trust him either? That's interesting."

Player_Romus

"Hegel does seem to take a genuine interest in Morella's welfare. I can understand the draw."

Alma Saltana

"To be clear, I trust him more than Patricio Alvarez. Or you, at this point."

Alma Saltana

"What would be the alternative? Allowing ex-colonies to slide into economic chaos? Letting the capitalist West take advantage of the power vacuum?"

Alma Saltana

"Some of his ideas are too radical for my people to accept, I know. But we do see eye to eye in many cases."

Alma Saltana

"I will consider what you're asking."

Player_Romus

"Sure. It'll come in handy if there's a leak in my palace roof that needs plugging."

Player_Romus

"Thank you for the offer, but I'm very full."

"Yes, please. I can't get enough of them."

Player_Romus

Alma Saltana

Alma Saltana

"Next time, then."

Alma Saltana

"That's surprising. I hear they're an acquired taste to outsiders. But take as many as you like."

I gave her a hug. She stiffly returned it.

Player_Romus

"Never mind. Maybe I'll give it to you next time."

Alma Saltana

"Well, now I'm intrigued."

Player_Romus

"A little something to sweeten the deal."

Player_Romus

"Our contractors found this artifact in the MITZ. I believe it belongs to Morella."

She stood up and pushed her chair back.

Alma Saltana

"Oh. Thank you."

Narrator

With a somewhat confused look, she put the medallion in her briefcase.

Alma Saltana

"You are right. It does belong to us."

Alma Saltana

With a smile, she put the medallion in her briefcase.

Alma Saltana

Alma Saltana

I bit into mine. It was dry, crumbly and barely sweet -- perfect for washing down with a sip of tea.
